Tender Name: National Module for Pre-Registration Nurses - General Practice and Primary Care
Description:
Health Education England (HEE) is responsible for providing education, training and personal development to every member of Health & Social Care - without a knowledgeable, skilled and confident workforce there would be no Health & Social Care.  In addition, HEE is responsible for the leadership of all healthcare education and training for those employed by the NHS and for those seeking NHS employment. HEE also has statutory obligations for the quality of the services which it funds and for the safety and protection of students and patients. 

This tender relates to the provision of a national module for Pre-Registration Nurses (covering all fields of nursing), Trainee Nursing Associates, Registered Nurses and Nursing Associates who have no prior experience of working in general practice but are considering a career in Primary Care/General Practice. This provision will enable growth in the number of registered staff to work in Primary Care/General Practice and provide consistency in training across the country. 

Other programmes are available for nurses in Primary Care/General Practice. However, this module is distinctly different and is aimed as either a pre-employment module, or as part of an induction for those already employed in another sector but wishing to move into Primary Care/General Practice.  Figure 1 outlines the target audience and where this module is positioned in relation to other programmes that are available upon being employed in Primary Care/General Practice.  

Further details and the tender documents can be download from the link below. 

https://health-family.force.com/s/Welcome
Address: Duncombe Steet, Leeds, LS1 4PL, GB

Tender Name: SWT-EBI-257 Crescent Car Park Improvement Works
Description:
Somerset West and Taunton Council is embarking on a significant project to transform The Crescent car park asset in Taunton to provide a high quality parking experience for its customers that takes account of the impacts such facilities have on the environment.

The development will deliver:

• effective vehicle and pedestrian management
• provide for electric vehicle charging points for both electric vehicles and mobility transportation that will meet increases in demands
• minor backlog repair works to the existing drainage systems
• modern payment options - new solar powered payment points
• CCTV Security installations - installation of new below ground ducts

Scope of Works:

1. Remove the existing wearing and base layers and renew to new specifications.
2. Change the layout of the car parks, incorporating enhanced space standards to individual parking spaces and to provide safer coloured pedestrian walkways throughout.
3. Provide 19no. useable electric vehicle charging points to the North car park and the installation of a new IMVA transformer.
4. Enhance the visual amenity of both car parks through the introduction of tree planting and the use of quality street furniture.
5. The scheme will make provision to screened off areas, such as bin stores, and to 'flag' the Bath Place pedestrian access way within the North car park.
6. Carry out repair work to existing below ground surface water drainage and road gullies.
Industry: Site preparation work - 45100000. Works for complete or part construction and civil engineering work - 45200000
Address: The Deane House, Belvedere Road, Taunton, TA1 1HE, United Kingdom

Tender Name: Supporting Parents to Avoid Recurrent Care Proceedings
Description:
Norfolk County Council is intending to procure a service, to commence April 2023, aimed at supporting vulnerable parents in Norfolk who have experienced care proceedings leading to the removal of children from their care. The procurement will be delivering against Public Health and Children's Social Care priorities with agreed targets and deliverables. The service should be responsive to demand, acknowledging that while the highest levels of need are most likely to be in Norfolk's urban hubs (Norwich, King's Lynn and Great Yarmouth) support will also need to be accessible to service users in more rural areas such as Breckland, South and North Norfolk. There are numerous, complex reasons that can lead to a family experiencing the removal of a child/children and we want to see fewer children coming in to care with fewer parents experiencing the loss associated with children being removed. The delivery partner will need to have a thorough knowledge of, and skilled approaches to address, the range of challenges these parents face; and be able to engage not only with people on an individual basis, but work in a way that sees them integrate with the existing infrastructure of support across our county. The work is likely to be a mix of direct delivery, group work and partnership working; supporting parents to engage with other skilled or specialist services where necessary. The service will need to be committed to supporting vulnerable parents to overcome persistent and enduring challenges, using approaches and techniques that will help them make the incremental changes that lead to significant progress over time. The intention is to let a contract for a period of up to 4-years, working in close partnership with the Local Authority delivering to a specific, eligible group of parents. The maximum potential value across the contract term is likely to be in the region of £1.2m. 
      If you are interested in this opportunity please express an interest. Applicants must first be registered on the system at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/norfolkcc. Full instructions for registration and use of the system can be found at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/norfolkcc/aspx/BuyerProfiles. Once registered you will be able to see the project under the `tenders` section and `express an interest`
Address: Martineau Lane, Norwich, Norfolk, NR1 2DH, United Kingdom

Tender Name: CST039 Provision of an Independent Domestic Violence Advisor Service in Derbyshire
Description:
The Derbyshire Independent Domestic Violence Advisor (IDVA) service is procured on behalf of a joint commissioning arrangement between Derbyshire County Council and the Police and Crime Commissioner (PCC).  Derbyshire County Council will act as the lead commissioner and will lead the procurement and will hold the contract with the successful provider. However, the successful contractor will report into jointly managed contract meetings, with equal representation from the Police and Crime Commissioner and Derbyshire County Council.

The contract is for the delivery of an adult IDVA service across the area of Derbyshire (excluding Derby City).

The contract will commence on 03 April 2023 for a period of 3 years with an option to extend for up to a further 2 x 1-year periods subject to satisfactory performance, appropriate approvals, outcomes, funding availability/budget approvals, price and need for the service.

The budget for this service is a maximum of £300,000 per annum for the first three years of the contract with options to extend for a further 2 by 1-year periods which are subject to funding availability/budget approvals. If the option to extend arises for Year 4 and Year 5, the budget would be confirmed during the first three years of the contract.  

The Commissioners are looking for a provider with expertise and proven capability in working with victims, perpetrators and families affected by Domestic Abuse. 

We welcome applications involving a range of provider models, including consortia arrangements, sole providers or partnership contract arrangements.
Address: County Hall, Matlock, DE4 3AG, England

Tender Name: 3457.EFM.SW.22 Engineering WC Refurbishments - Broad Lane & Portobello Centre
Description:
The University of Sheffield is out to tender on behalf of the Department of Estates and Facilities Management for refurbishment of Portobello Rd and Broad Lane WC's. The project comprises the refurbishment of WC areas throughout two buildings within the University of Sheffield's campus: Broad Lane Building, Broad Lane, Sheffield S1 4BT, and Portobello Centre, 1 Mappin St, Sheffield S1 4DT. The aim of the project is to upgrade existing WC facilities within these buildings to meet modern standards, as part of a wider scheme focusing on the refurbishment of all WCs within the University's engineering departments. The proposed works are to comprise the following:

•M&E works to be carried out in accordance with A&P specifications. To include isolation of water supply and M&E services, and the removal and disposal of existing light fittings and hand dryers.
•Strip-out and disposal of existing sanitary ware, including vanity units, IPS paneling, cubicles, basins, urinals, toilets, hand dryers and all other associated fixtures, fittings and pipework. 
•The careful removal and disposal of floor tiles, wall tiles and suspended ceilings.
•The partial removal and disposal of solid masonry walls. 
•Making good and levelling of all disturbed surfaces associated with the strip-out.
•The installation of new sanitary ware including vanity units, IPS paneling, cubicles, basins, urinals, toilets, hand dryers and all other associated fixtures, fittings and pipework. All M&E components are to be installed in accordance with A&P specifications.
•The installation of new vinyl flooring, vinyl coved skirting and suspended ceilings, and thorough redecoration. To include the construction of new bulkheads, boxings, plasterboard partitions and tiled splash backs where specified.
*Please note the above list is not exhaustive. 

Site visits for suppliers are to planned  to provide an opportunity for tenderer's to further ascertain the nature of the site, access thereto and all local conditions and restrictions likely to affect the execution of the Works. These are not mandatory.  

This is a non-EU open tender exercise. The Invitation to Tender (ITT) can be downloaded by registering and expressing your interest on the University`s e-tendering system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield. Tender Name: Request For Quotation for Collision Database Software
Description:
Cambridgeshire County Council (CCC) is looking to procure collision database software to collate, edit, validate and analyse STATS19 data. CCC receive the data from the police on a weekly basis. Our current AccsMap contract ended on 31st March 2022 after a 5-year period. As a result, we are looking to procure a tool that meets all our essential requirements and as many of our desirable requirements whilst offering good value for money.   

CCC are looking to procure a system that can consolidate the collision data into a single database for both Cambridgeshire and Peterborough. Peterborough currently outsources their collision data collation, validation and DfT return to Cambridgeshire so a system that both authorities can access would be beneficial, i.e. hosted in a cloud environment rather than on a single authority's local server. It is hoped that moving to a cloud-based environment will also provide speed benefits compared to accessing the data from CCC's local Citrix server as per the current setup. An externally hosted solution is the council's preference as this aligns with the council's IT strategy.
Address: New Shire Hall, Alconbury Weald, Huntingdon, PE28 4YE, United Kingdom
Previous notice about this procurement: Request For Quotation for Collision Database SoftwareOpportunityPublished  5 September 2022

Tender Name: Sept 2022 Gloucestershire Health and Social Care Pseudo-Framework 2020-2024
Description:
September 2022 Re-Opening of the Framework

The pseudo-framework for Gloucestershire Health & Social Care is reopened annually for Lots 1-5b: supported living non complex / support living complex / floating support for children and young people / forensic support services / domiciliary care /domiciliary care complex.

The original tender was first issued in 2019 and the framework went live in 2020.

The services required under this procurement falls within Schedule 3 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (SI 2015/102) and are therefore not bound by all of its requirements. The Council will follow its own modified version of the framework process described under Regulation 33. The modified process, includes the ability to reopen the tender annually, or as required to ensure coverage of service areas.

**This 2022 opportunity to join the framework opens on 5th September 2022 and all tender responses must be submitted by 31st October 2022 10am*

This procurement will be set up a pseudo framework agreement to provide health and social care across Gloucestershire for domiciliary care, and community-based support services for adults and children (where regulations allow), with a learning disability, physical disability, autism and/or a mental health condition, through several different frameworks.
The framework is divided into 6 lots.
The services required under this procurement will fall within Schedule 3 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (SI 2015/102) and are therefore not bound by all of its requirements. The Council will follow its own modified version of the framework process described under Regulation 33. The modified process, includes the ability to reopen the tender annually, or as required to ensure coverage of service areas.

This framework and all the LOTs is open to the following users:
Clinical Commissioning Group\\r
Gloucestershire Health & Care NHS Foundation Trust

Total value of the framework for the 4 years is estimated to be £244m

Tender Name: HMS Warrior Electrical Rewiring ITT
Department: THE NATIONAL MUSEUM OF THE ROYAL NAVY
Description:
In 2017 the HMS Warrior Preservation Trust merged with the National Museum of the Royal Navy (NMRN), following the merger the NMRN conducted surveys of Warrior's electrical systems and identified that it requires extensive rewiring work. Previously in 2018 a tender was advertised but was not awarded following feedback from the submitted bids.

The ship and its systems host a staff presence 24/7 across the whole year, with members of the public visiting during opening hours of Portsmouth Historic Dockyard. The ship hosts events on board throughout the year, with catering for events being supplied by the fully equipped professional kitchen on board the ship. The ship maintains numerous systems such as; a macerator, speaker, fire detection, lighting and ventilation systems alongside the public-facing role.  This tender is intended to help support the current and future power requirements of the NMRN onboard HMS Warrior.

The NMRN is seeking to rewire HMS Warrior to bring all electrical systems on board up to standard, this is across the ship and partially to the jetty alongside Warrior. The scope of work that suppliers will be required to replace and update includes;
-	Removal and replacement of the existing electrical circuits onboard including; LV/Small Power Systems
-	Removal of existing Fire Alarm and commissioning new Fire Alarm System (to L5 standard and L1 performance) across the ship.
-	Removal and Installation of a new ship-wide PA System
-	Removal and Updating of CCTV System 
-	Replacement of HVAC Ventilation System Wiring and Controls
-	Provisions to replace and update the Mast Downlights and fittings for Seasonal Lighting (Foremast Christmas Tree lights).
-	Requirement to refurbish approx. 150-period accurate replica light fittings; including updating to LED lighting and rewiring to reinstall and reuse.

These requirements may change in scope so this is currently indicative of at the time of writing. Full details can be found in the documentation attached to this tender.

The NMRN is using a JCT Design & Build Contract for this tender, please see the attached Annex C appendixes for further details.

The NMRN encourage all interested suppliers to attend a site visit to see HMS Warrior and throughout the ship in order to further understand the requirements of the NMRN Tender. 

Site Visits may be booked via tenders@nmrn.org.uk and should give at least two working days to make arrangements.
The dates to book a site visit are;

Wednesday 21st September
Thursday 22nd September
Friday 23rd September (Morning Only)

All clarification questions should be sent to tenders@nmrn.org.uk, with responses released throughout the clarification period.
Address: National Museum of the Royal Navy (NMRN), Main Road, HM Naval Base, PORTSMOUTH, PO1 3NH, England

Tender Name: WA12266 - HSCNAs & EHIAs into H&J services across the South East - Lots 1&2
Description:
NHS England (South East) (the Commissioner) invites bids from suitably qualified and experienced providers, to undertake a Health & Social Care Needs Assessment (HSCNA) and Equality and Health Inequalities Impact Assessment (EHIA) for the commissioning of Healthcare provision of two Health and Justice related services. 
 NHSE intend to publish the HSCNAs and EHIAs in three batches, split into several lots to group Health and Justice services appropriately.  
This advert relates to Batch 1 only and has been split into two lots including Sexual Assault Referral Centres (SARCs) and Liaison & Diversion (L&D) services. For both lots, services cover the regions of Hampshire, Kent, Surrey, Sussex and Thames Valley. 
The second Batch is anticipated to be published towards the end of October 2022 and Batch 3 has an indicative publication date of end February 2023.
HSCNA is a systematic method for reviewing the health issues facing a population, leading to agreed priorities and resource allocation that will improve health and reduce inequalities (NICE, 2005). HSCNAs play an important part in guiding an organisation in effectively balancing their efforts in achieving the goals and objectives specific to their strategic direction alongside the government policy and direction of the time. 
The EHIA will assess the equality of healthcare service delivery within a secure estate and identify which groups are disadvantaged as well providing actions to improve service delivery for those groups. 
Providers who wish to view further information  and submit a bid, will need to register on the e-procurement system, Atamis, available on the following link: https://health-family.force.com/s/Welcome 
The contract is due to commence in January 2023, and the contract duration will be 3 years. The maximum contract value is £360,000 for all lots over the contract term.
This process is being managed by NHS South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit (SCW) on behalf of the Commissioners.
NHSE South East will not be liable for costs incurred by any interested party in participating in this exercise. 
The services are deemed to be subject to the full regime of current European Union (EU) procurement legislation and as such this tender will be conducted in accordance with, and governed by, the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.  This contract will therefore be awarded in accordance with the provisions applicable in Section 5 (sub-section 7) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.
Address: South Plaza, Marlborough Street, Bristol, BS1 3NX, GB

Tender Name: CEFAS22-87 RFQ for analysis of epibenthic imagery from West of Wight Barfleur and Haig Fras
Description:
Cefas/JNCC wish to commission a contract to undertake the analysis of still seabed imagery collected on the CEND0121 and CEND0719 surveys. 

Cefas and JNCC undertook a survey of West of Wight Barfleur MCZ (WWBF hereafter) between 22nd and 25th January 2021, cruise code CEND0121.

The aim of the survey was to collect data from WWBF to inform assessment of the condition of the feature attributes (i.e. extent, distribution, structure and function, and supporting processes) of the designated features (broadscale sedimentary habitats). 

Video observations were made with a drop camera (DC) system. The DC was equipped with a high-definition video camera and a separate still image camera unit, in a planar (downwards facing) orientation inside the frame. The stills camera was fitted with a two-spot (green) laser-scaling device with laser points set 220mm apart.

100m length DC transects were carried out at 40 sampling locations based on regular triangular grid (including increased replication transects at a subset of six sampling stations). 

Images from each transect have been pre-selected at random to provide a calculated field of view from ~14m2 to ~24m2 per transect. 1303 images have been selected in total for analysis from WWBF.

A further 522 still images acquired at the pinnacles within Haig Fras (HGFR) SAC have also been included for this analysis contract. These were also captured with the same DC system during the earlier 2019 CEND0719 Survey. These images are still subject to final filtering and so the number may reduce, tenderers should provide quotes accounting for a maximum of 522 still images from this survey.
Address: Pakefield Road, Lowestoft, NR33 0HT, England

Tender Name: All Age Transport Dynamic Purchasing System
Description:
London Borough of Ealing wishes to carry out market engagement and invite expressions of interest from providers interested in tendering for a refreshed All Age Transport Dynamic Purchasing System during Autumn 2022. A market engagement event will be held in Ealing on 27th July 2022. Interested providers should register on pro contract, express an interest and register for the event using the messaging system at the link below 

https://procontract.due-north.com/Procurer/Advert/View?advertId=f476383f-0a01-ed11-8116-005056b64545&fromAdvertEvent=True

You are also invited to fill in a market engagement questionnaire at the link below.  
This market engagement questionnaire is voluntary, and providers are in no way obliged to complete it, or to answer every question within it. However we hope providers will complete is as it will assist us greatly in informing our future strategy to commission All Age Transport Services

Your response is not part of any tender or contract, will be treated as confidential and the information you provide will only be used for market research purposes.

https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=Q4w6AYeCi0yHixMeMM2587EA_uOE1tlMoKwmIfUQZbdUMVY5MkZZQ1M4Wk5WR1RNOEE4VzA1REU2Qy4u

Subject to governance it is envisaged the All Age Transport DPS would:
• commence in Spring 2023, for a duration of 5 years with the option to extend, in any increment, for  up to 4 years, and;
• have multiple categories for vehicle types and also a separate category for passenger assistants.
• cover procurement of circa £11m of services for transporting and supporting vulnerable children and adults with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities (SEND) travelling to, School, College, Adults Day Centres and, ad hoc Services for Children and Adults

Safety and wellbeing of vulnerable people is a crucially important factor in the procurement of these services. LBE is interested in engaging with a range of providers in relation to passenger transport and passenger assistants, including efficiency, the use of technology, market innovation and sustainability.

Future use of the DPS cannot be specified at this stage, and volumes are not guaranteed. However as current LBE contracts for transport come to an end during 2023 onwards, subject to governance and using a phased approach, it is envisaged that all Children's and Adult's transport routes, and ad hoc spend on taxis will be purchased via the DPS during the next 5 - 7 years.

Tender Name: Appointment of a Construction Multi-Disciplinary Professional Services Team to transform National Museums Liverpool's  International Slavery Museum & Maritime Museum
Description:
National Museums Liverpool (NML) is seeking to appoint a Construction Multi-Disciplinary Professional Services Team, who can provide External Project Manager services, Quantity Surveyor services, BIM Manager services and CDM Advisor services to transform the International Slavery Museum and Maritime Museum.   

      The appointed Professional Services Team will be required to work with NML's internal Project delivery team, external Architectural Design Team, external Exhibition Design Team and NML's external stakeholders and community groups to develop and deliver the project through RIBA Stages 2 - 7.  Liaison with consultant teams working on the wider Waterfront project will also be required as the project progresses. 

      Our ambition is to create a new venue of the Martin Luther King Jr and Hartley Pavilion buildings and the two museums they house, that allows both to flourish and achieve NML's vision for them. This transformation will be led by our communities in a co-production approach that will define how we develop our vision. We will do this through refurbishing and developing the MLK as a dedicated space for the International Slavery Museum and its communities with a link-bridge into re-interpreted galleries within the Hartley Pavilion. Alongside this, we will re-interpret the Maritime Museum, which is also housed in the Hartley Pavilion and ensure it achieves its vision as one of the key museums in NML, and create a new, open and more accessible venue for commercial purposes. 

      NML is looking for a Professional Services Team that can demonstrate the following:

      1.  Experience supporting Client Team with the management, development, and delivery of large and complex cultural, conservation and heritage projects. 
      2.  Experience of managing and delivering capital projects, similar in style to NML's museum project which include Base Build and Exhibition Fit Out works
      3.  Experience of similar style projects, such as those that have been funded by Cultural, Heritage or Public Sector funding bodies such as National Lottery Heritage Fund.
      4.  Experience and the abilities to understand and manage both the capital refurbishment of the two buildings and separately, the exhibition design and development of the two museums. 
      5.  Ability to carry out the services required and have relevant experience of a working on projects of similar size, scope, nature, and complexity to the ISM/MM Transformation project. 

      Further information is provided in the Scope of Services (Documents 1.3.1, 1.3.2, 1.3.3 and 1.3.4); Project Brief (Document 1.2) and accompanying procurement documents.

Tender Name: Learning and Skills Provision at HMP Berwyn
Description:
The Learning and Skills provision is to deliver a minimum of 488 and a maximum of 609 Learning and Skills activity places per day across 21 classrooms and 3 vocational workshops and embedded across the prison. 

The Authority's key objectives for the Contract are to:

-	Allow for the delivery of a 'Whole Prison Approach' to ensure the service provided is joined-up, streamlined and supports the integration of the industries, custody, education and health services;
-	Provide prisoners with employability skills which better prepare them for employment and thereby contribute to the rehabilitative culture of HMP Berwyn and support the reduction of re-offending;
-	Deliver high quality learning and the vision for the prison;
-	Embed Learning and Skills within the prison through a delivery model that is engaging and motivational and removes barriers to learning.

The Service - high level requirements:

-	The successful Bidder shall be required to design the provision to meet the learning needs of the prison population, the education and employment opportunities in the resettlement areas prisoners return to following release from custody and to fit the prison's core day and operational conditions.
-	The successful Bidder will be expected to provide assessment and learning and skills places from the Service commencement date.
-	The aim of the daily regime at the Prison is to create a balanced and integrated regime. All Prisoners will have the opportunity to be out of their cell and participate in learning activities except when the needs of safety and security prevent it, or a Prisoner is undergoing punishment including Basic Regime under the IEP scheme.

The successful Bidder will share the vision for the prison and will have an important role in promoting the learning culture throughout the prison and demonstrate support for the organisational values.

The Contract has a four (4) year initial duration, plus an optional two (2) year extension and a further one (1) year extension if agreed by both the Authority and the Supplier.

The Authority is using the Jaggaer electronic eSourcing Portal (formerly Bravo) for the procurement. The ITT, which is comprised of a number of volumes, is available only in electronic format via the eSourcing Portal. Bidders must register the names of all contacts requiring access to the sourcing event and should submit queries via the eSourcing Portal. 

Link to the eSourcing Portal:
https://ministryofjusticecommercial.bravosolution.co.uk/web/login.html

Tender Name: SCC - Prj 1673 Back of House Refurbishment to Southend Crematorium
Description:
Southend on Sea City Council are carrying out this procurement in the form of an Open Tender for the provision of the Back of House Refurbishment works to Southend Crematorium in order to accommodate 3 new Cremators and associated plant.  The manufacture, supply, and installation of the 3 new cremators, associated plant and temporary external cremator will be carried out by Facultatieve Technologies (FT) who have been appointed by SCC under a JCT 2016 Design and Build Contract.  It is a condition of this tender that the contract with FT will be novated over to the successful Contractor once they are appointed.
The refurbishment works includes the replacement of the three existing cremators and plant including a temporary external cremator to allow the crematorium to operate during the works (to be carried out by FT).  It will also include the demolition of the existing brick chimney, renewal of the flat roof coverings, and structural and internal alterations to the internal spaces to create a more efficient work environment.
The contract will be let under JCT 2016 Design and Build Contract with Employers Requirements, drawings, contract sum analysis, building specification, mechanical and electrical specification.
The contractor will be expected to complete the detailed design of RIBA Stages 4 to 7.
Industry: Construction work for crematoriums - 45215300. Refurbishment work - 45453100

Tender Name: Athlete Medical Insurance Scheme
Description:
UK Sport's Athlete Medical Scheme (AMS) is a medical insurance scheme which covers the costs of healthcare of funded athletes who are members of Olympic and Paralympic sports World Class Programmes. National Governing Bodies, funded or unfunded, may also purchase places on AMS at an agreed cost by UK Sport, to provide medical cover to athletes not on a World Class Programme.
The mission of the AMS is to drive an efficient and effective athlete medical scheme to develop athlete health and wellbeing. Beneath this mission are three objectives:

1.	Ensure that athletes receive timely and high-quality medical care when needed to bring them back to full health and fitness

2.	Ensure that the AMS scheme is cost and operationally efficient, effective and understood by all stakeholders

3.	Drive the insights from AMS usage to identify opportunities to advance the Athlete Health strategy

To meet these objectives and advance the scheme, UK Sport facilitates and chair a governance group made up of medical leads from within the high-performance system, the incumbent medical insurance provider and insurance brokers, and the AMS Manager. This group meet on a quarterly basis, ensuring good governance of the scheme.

UK Sport pays an annual premium to cover the costs of claims and, subject to approval and conditions of cover by AMS the athlete receives healthcare. It is a free service to athletes and no costs are recharged to their governing bodies. An initial introduction to AMS is set out in the information leaflet at Appendix 1.

The pre-authorisation of claims is conducted by an AMS Manager, employed within the British Olympic Association (BOA) and who is the key liaison for claims with the incumbent insurance provider. The Athlete Medical Scheme Manager will maintain records of pre-authorised claims on the Athlete Medical Scheme system and oversee claims against agreed benefit limits.

AMS is due for renewal with effect from 1 April 2023. UK Sport now invites Tenders for the provision of AMS in accordance with this ITT and the attached documents. UK Sport seeks to enter into a long-term arrangement with a sole insurer supplier for the next 3 years with a possible extension for a further 1 year. UK Sport seek to also insert a break clause after 12 months of the agreement commencing.
As this process is conducted using the open procedure, there is no separate pre-qualification stage or questionnaire.

To receive ITT documentation, please e-mail:

Procurement@uksport.gov.uk
Address: 21 Bloomsbury Street, LONDON, WC1B3HF, England

Tender Name: NHSE856
Description:
North of England Commissioning Support (NECS) are working for, and on behalf of, NHS England and NHS Improvement - North West who wish to commission three separate lots of specialist led primary care orthodontic provision in the following areas:

Lot 1 - Cheshire East (East)
Lot 2 - Cheshire East (South)
Lot 3 - Blackburn 

The basic principles that mirror that of the open procedure will be followed for this procurement to test the capacity, capability, and technical competence of tenderers in accordance with the Light Touch Regime within The Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (as amended), ensuring a fair, open, and transparent process in accordance with NHS (Procurement, Patient Choice and Competition) (No. 2) Regulations 2013.

Under the Public Services (Social Value) Act 2012 the Contracting Authority must consider:
(a) How what is proposed to be procured might improve the economic, social, and environmental well-being of the area where it exercises its functions, and 
(b) How, in conducting the process of procurement, it might act with a view to securing that improvement. 

Accordingly, the subject matter of the contract has been scoped to take into account the priorities of the Contracting Authority relating to economic, social and environmental well-being. 

This procurement will be conducted via the NECS e-tendering system (In-tend) as such there will be no hard copy documents issued to bidders and all communications between bidders and NECS, including tender submissions, will be conducted via the In-tend portal. 

To express an interest in tendering for this procurement, please register on the In-tend e-tendering portal, which can be found at: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/nhsnecsu and follow the registration instructions. 

Please note that it is free to register on In-tend, which can be accessed at any time of day. 

Should you have any queries, or are having problems using the portal, you should contact the e-Tendering provider by Email: support@in-tend.com or by phone 0844 2728810 (Monday to Friday 8:30am to 5.00pm). 

PLEASE NOTE: Tender documentation will be available via In-tend from 5th September 2022 and the closing date for receipt of tenders is 12 noon on 7th November 2022.
Procurement reference: Specialist Led Primary Care Orthodontic Service
Address: Regatta Place, Liverpool, L3 4BL, England

Tender Name: Supply of EM Scanner
Description:
The Authority is seeking to purchase the following:

1. no. EM Scanner, to meet the following minimum specification:
a.	Scanning minimum lowest frequency 150kHz 
b.	Scanning maximum upper frequency 6GHz
c.	Minimum Spatial resolution 7.5mm
d.	Covering an area of no less than 30cm x 20cm
e.	High speed measurements (area of 100mm2 with a 100MHz span in less than 1 minute)
f.	Measurement plane isolation greater than 20dB
g.	Minimum rated power load 1W (30dBm)
h.	Maximum weight 3kg
i.	Compatibility with Siglent and Signal hound spectrum analysers
j.	Compatible with Windows 10 or higher

1. no. 3D EM Probe, to meet the following minimum specification:
a.	Ability to cover DUT (Device Under Test) dimensions 15cm height, 30cm area
b.	Maximum weight 4kg
c.	Minimum Spatial resolution 7.5mm
d.	Compatible with Windows 10 or higher

1. no. Near Field probe Set, to meet the following minimum specification:
a.	Probes with a flat response to cover RF range from 10MHz to 8GHz 
b.	Compatibility with EM Probe above and software below

4.	
1 no, Software capable of
a.	To display output from the EM Scanner and 3D EM probe
b.	Heat map visualisation of EM emissions
c.	Overlay of either images or circuit schematics
d.	Modes to include; broad spectrum sweep or spot frequency scanning
e.	3D visualisation
f.	To include a 5 year license
g.	Drivers to support Siglent and Signal Hound spectrum analysers

Interested parties should submit the following by email to the contact details provided in this notice no later than the end date detailed:
1) Firm, fixed quotation in £ sterling, with an estimated leadtime for delivery. Any and all charges to be clearly shown.
2) A detailed specification for the equipment and software (note that the Authority will not accept responses for part of the equipment)..
3) Your bank and payment details on letter headed paper.
4) A signed copy of our Ethics Policy (attached).
5) All responses will be deemed to be issued subject to the Authority's Standard Terms and Conditions (attached). Caveats to these Terms will not be accepted.
6) The Authority will evaluate all responses in accordance with the attached model evaluation model. The lowest cost supplier who offers an acceptable Leadtime and meets the minimum specification will be deemed successful, subject to contract. All responses and or questions to the contact shown below.
Industry: Measuring instruments - 38300000. Scanners - 38520000. Machines and apparatus for testing and measuring - 38540000
Address: 1 St Floor Building 71, MILTON KEYNES, MK197BH, England

Tender Name: SPS 2629 - Provision of Locum Education Psychologists
Description:
The Royal Borough of Greenwich is seeking to commission a new open framework agreement consisting of multiple, specialist agencies/providers to supply Locum Educational Psychologists to (1) complete statutory psychological advice in respect of children and young people undergoing statutory assessment under the provisions of the Children & Families Act (2014), and (2) to work within a consultation framework to deliver a traded Educational Psychology service to schools in the Royal Borough of Greenwich.
The successful agencies/providers will enter into a Framework Agreement to provide Locum Education Psychologists cover to work:
•	across the Borough of Greenwich
•	Across phases of educational provision including early years, primary secondary and post 16.
•	With children and young people 0-25 years and their families 
•	Across types of educational provision including specialist and mainstream settings
•	In home and residential settings as needed
•	Across all core areas of need as set out in the SEND Code of Practice, dependent on experience.
•	Collaboratively with colleagues within the Children's Services department, with schools/settings and partner agencies and with parents and carers to support the promotion and implementation of local and national priorities and initiatives regarding children & young people.

The successful agencies/providers will be expected to provide Educational Psychologists that meet all the required mandatory as laid out in the specification document.

The call off procedure will be via direct call off, or a mini competition. The procurement will take place under the Open Procedure as stipulated in the Public Contracts Regulations 2015. The Framework Agreement awarded will be for a period of four years and shall be awarded to multiple providers. Forecasts indicate that total expenditure in this area over the four year period which will be approximately £630K.

Tender Name: Counselling - Early Intervention and Prevention Services within the Children and Family Centres and Other Related Venues
Description:
Early intervention counselling for families; this will be family units including the children (who could be any age).  This is early intervention counselling therefore a model of no more than 8 sessions excluding the initial and final assessment should be sufficient.  
The focus is to reduce family breakdown, improve family relationships and increase emotional/mental wellbeing for all family members.  
There is a requirement for any successful organisations to commit to referring any families/parents/children onto appropriate statutory emotional wellbeing and mental health services if they are deemed at assessment to be beyond early intervention, and to advise the referrer of their decision not to take the case and confirming the action they have taken instead.
A contract for a maximum number of families will be awarded and the flow of families will be managed through the Early Intervention and Family Support Service via a single point of referral.  A formalised referral process will be agreed upon award of the contract.

Description:
Activities for parents with their children, involving music to enrich and stimulate their children's early brain development and to improve their readiness for school. Incorporating other skills such as use of basic signing / rhyming would be welcomed.

Sessions should target families with children in different age / stage abilities e.g. baby, or toddler, or pre-school. Back to back sessions with a short 'reset' period between them could be programmed.

Activities should be affordable and easy for parents to duplicate at no/low cost at home with their children.

We require a programme of up to six sessions of Sessions should not exceed 60 mins and be accessible as 'stand-alone' sessions.
Address: Bromley Civic Centre Stockwell Close, Stockwell Close, Bromley, BR1 3UH, England

Tender Name: Sports - Early Intervention and Prevention Services within the Children and Family Centres and Other Related Venues
Description:
Activities for parents with their children, to support the development of motor skills in young children and stimulate their children's early brain development and to improve their readiness for school.
Activities should be affordable and easy for parents to duplicate at no/low cost at home with their children.
Activities should be able to be adapted to be delivered both inside and outside, in a small or large environment, with one or more children so that families can benefit from the session and repeat the activity with their wider family in their own home or local area.
We require a programme of up to six sessions. Sessions should not exceed 60 mins and be accessible as 'stand-alone' sessions.
We would welcome this for day, evening or weekend delivery.
Address: Bromley Civic Centre Stockwell Close, Stockwell Close, Bromley, BR1 3UH, England

Tender Name: Engaging Fathers - Early Intervention and Prevention Services within the Children and Family Centres and Other Related Venues
Description:
Innovative creative ideas for interactions and sessions for fathers ideally with their children - Dads have told us they do not want "Dads' football"...

Sessions should help fathers engage with their children's development, be active and positive male role models, and increase their confidence in their role as a parent.

Suggestions should be affordable and sustainable and easy for fathers to duplicate at no/low cost at home with their children.
Some suggestions by Dads have included: -
• Science / experiments activities
• Discovery / exploration activities
• Construction activities
• Sport activities
• Ways to engage with their daughters and sons on a personal level e.g. hair braiding

Sessions that run during the day or early evenings Monday to Friday as well as Saturday mornings, ideally with but also without their children, will be considered.

No duplication of existing statutory midwifery / Health visitor services, or any of the parenting programmes offered within Bromley's Children and Family Centres

Sessions should be at least 60mins but not exceed 1hr 45mins, and work effectively as 'stand-alone' sessions.
Address: Bromley Civic Centre Stockwell Close, Stockwell Close, Bromley, BR1 3UH, England

Tender Name: 11 kV Substation Construction and Infrastructure Works
Description:
The Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea (RBKC) is an Inner London borough with royal status. It is the smallest borough in London and the second smallest district in England; it is one of the most densely populated administrative regions in the United Kingdom. 

Following engagement with UK Power Networks (UKPN) for their services in providing a 3.8MVA (11kV) ring-main supply, RBKC will be constructing their own substation, along with transformer, associated high-voltage and low-voltage switchgear. This project will require both civil and building works to install ductworks and sub-main cabling to the required final service heads.

The new power supply will be serving two individual LV sub-main supplies as well as offering a level of future resilience in the councils move towards our net carbon zero Carbon (NZT) target. 

The contractor will be required to:

-	Consult with UKPN to align RBKC's programmed works for the substation construction with UKPN's new 11kV infrastructure.
-	Submit a design proposal which meets an agreed specification for the substation construction including all electrical and building works in connection.
-	Procure all materials and sub-contract services required for the project, again meeting the specification provided by RBKC.
-	Have all construction works completed in a timely manner, within the agreed timeframe and to a high standard of workmanship.

The 11kV supply works will be procured directly from UKPN by RBKC  and fall outside of the scope of works for this project.

The contractor will need to hold National Electricity Registration Scheme (NERS) accreditation as an Independent Connection Provider (ICP) and must be registered on the UKPN approved contractor scheme for ICPs.

The Council is ideally seeking to engage with a provider with relevant qualification and experience to discuss what this service/work may look like. To register your expression of interest kindly visit our e-tendering portal; www.capitalesourcing.com (search for the following reference: itt_RBKC_16288, download, complete and submit the provided EOI form: 

Please note the Council reserves the right to amend any details related to this contract at any time and only invite those suppliers to the tender who registered their expression of interest.

If you have any questions, please submit these through the e-tendering portal.

Tender Name: UK-Korea FTA Review - Research into Korea's Positions
Description:
The UK-Korea Continuity FTA came into force on 1 January 2021. As part of the continuity agreement, the parties agreed to 'commence negotiations, to build on the existing terms of this agreement and seek further liberalisation' within two years. As a result, the UK and Korea are due to commence renegotiation of the FTA throughout 2023.  

In order to inform the renegotiation of the UK-Korea FTA, we would like to commission research exploring Korean interests on key policy areas. In particular, those where we expect Korean offensive asks or strong resistance to UK positions. The project should identify Korean interests, key drivers behind their positions, relevant Korean stakeholders, and potential levers of influence to inform the UK.
Industry: Feasibility study, advisory service, analysis - 71241000. Research services - 73110000

Tender Name: Uncrewed Surface & Subsurface Vessel (USSV)
Description:
The Authority has a developing requirement to demonstrate a full-scale prototype of an autonomous vessel capability that is able to transit on the surface at speed, quickly transitioning sub-surface for covert delivery of capabilities.  Integration into an open architecture network (NSN) will be critical for these vessels to operate autonomously and deploy modular mission payloads. 
The littoral strike battlespace commander requires surveillance, reconnaissance, electronic warfare, and strike effectors, which can be covertly deployed to multiple simultaneous maritime locations and persist to enhance commando operations.  The capability must have a useful service life, operate from the broadest range of platforms, worldwide, by day and night, survive likely threats and be deliverable.  
Due to the rapid timescales the authority is driving, we would expect that companies we will be working with will have already successfully designed, manufactured and operated an autonomous vessel (as described above) capable of surface and sub-surface operation up to at least fully-operational demonstrator stage. If companies have not achieved this to date, we would expect companies to achieve a minimum entry criteria, potentially backed up by authority SQEP panel via on-site visits to confirm that you have capabilities, resources, plans and measures in place to meet this requirement within the given timescales. Please provide supporting evidence to the above within the white paper.
It is expected that the work will involve experimentation and demonstrations of an uncrewed Surface and subsurface vessel. The contractual mechanism is intended to be a multi-supplier framework. Potential bidders are invited to register their interest in receiving an Invitation to Tender to join the framework by first completing the associated Pre-Qualification Questionnaire (PQQ) and White Paper template.
The Authority intends to invite all eligible companies who pass the PQQ to tender for the Framework. Companies who successfully pass the PQQ will be considered eligible to receive an Invitation to Tender at the next stage of the programme.  c.£4.45M inc VAT is available to be split amongst multiple companies under a competitive process and assessed for best Value For Money (VFM), awarding to 1 or more companies to accelerate towards Min Viable Product (MVP) within the Design/Re-design, Manufacture and Demo phases between Dec 22 and Mar 25.
The process as currently defined post PQQ will be to issue an ITT against a minimum requirement, select bidders, accelerate the proposed systems through funding, with the intent of having a full scale demonstration within the framework duration.
As with any framework, there can be no guarantee of any particular quantity of work being put through it.
Address: #1261 Spruce 2B, DE&S Abbey Wood, Filton, Bristol, BS34 8JH, England

Tender Name: PRJ1111 - Mental Health Supported Living - Southwark - SEL ICB
Department: N E L COMMISSIONING SUPPORT UNIT
Description:
This is a prior information notice of an upcoming procurement process for Mental Health Supported Living Services. NHS South East London Integrated Care Board (NHS SEL ICB, known as NHS South East London) will soon be undertaking a procurement process to select service providers for seven (7) mental health supported living contracts; each based at a specific premises in the borough of Southwark. Commissioners are seeking feedback from interested organisations in the form of completed Market Engagement Questionnaires (MEQ).

The sites are:

- 212 Peckham Rye

- Dunton Road

- Glengarry Road

- Kirkwood Road

- Milestone 1 Wales Close

- St James' House

- Landcroft Road

Interested organisation must express an interest via Pro-contract e-tendering portal. Bidders needs to register on Pro-contract if they are not registered already. This can be done by clicking the below link.

https://procontract.due-north.com/Register

Once registered, you can express an interest in this project by clicking the following link to this specific project:

https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=d7e63c34-e02a-ed11-8119-005056b64545

Please note that any expressions of interests by any other means will not be considered.

Once you navigate to the project area you can access the Market Engagement materials provided in the messaging facility. Interested organisations are requested to complete and submit a copy of the Market Engagement Questionnaire no later than 19th September 2022 at 12.00 (noon) via the portal messaging facility.

One in four people in the UK will suffer a mental health problem in the course of a year. Mental illness covers a wide range of conditions such as depression, anxiety disorders and obsessive-compulsive disorders, through to more severe conditions like schizophrenia.

Common mental disorders (CMD) include conditions such as depression and anxiety. Results from the 2014 Adult Psychiatric Morbidity Survey (APMS) show that 1 in 6 adults had a common mental disorder (CMD) in the week prior to the survey, rising to almost in 1 in 5 adults in London.

Mental ill-health represents a significant burden on our local population and the health and care system. It is estimated that almost 47,600 adults in Southwark are currently experiencing a CMD, this is expected to rise to approximately 52,000 individuals over the next decade

Although less disabling than major psychiatric disorders, the higher prevalence of CMD mean that their cumulative cost to society is greater. All types of CMD are more prevalent in women than among men, and they are also more likely to experience more severe symptoms. Young women were identified as a particularly high-risk group with an estimated 5,600 cases in the borough. Employment and socio-economic status were identified as a substantial risk factor. In Southwark, approximately half of the claims for employment and support allowance (ESA) are related to mental health - with 6,000 cases in February 2016.
Address: 160 Tooley Street, LONDON, SE1 2TZ, England

Tender Name: Sierra Leone Secondary Education Improvement Project Phase 2 (SSEIP II) EME
Description:
The Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO) intends to publish a tender opportunity for the Sierra Leone Secondary Education Improvement Project Phase 2 (SSEIP II) in September 2022. The Opportunity Notice and Contract Notice will be published on the Contracts Finder and Find a Tender Service (FTS) websites respectively to alert the market and provide the instruction on how to access the tender documents via the FCDO Procurement portal.

SSEIP II is the successor programme to SSEIP I which contributed to a 46% increase in the number of girls and disabled children in secondary school, and a doubling in examination passes for girls in Sierra Leone. SSEIP II has been designed to deliver the UK's commitment to girls' education and aims to strengthen government systems in Sierra Leone to deliver improved education for adolescent girls and children with disabilities.
A market engagement event was previously held on 10 June 2021.

The aim of this engagement to is to raise awareness of this upcoming opportunity, gather feedback on the ToR and to solicit interest.
Please find attached a draft ToR and Market questions. Responses can be provided by competing the attached questionnaire by Thursday 15th September. Email responses should be sent to milena.bandere@fcdo.gov.uk

Tender Name: Quotation for Supply of Master Scoping Consultancy for Sandwell Valley
Description:
Overview
      Sandwell Council, Borough Economy, are seeking a consultant or consultancy to conduct a master plan scoping exercise and deliver a final master plan for consideration for Sandwell Valley. 
      Sandwell Valley Country Park 
      Sandwell Valley Country Park is the jewel in Sandwell's crown. With over 308 hectares of open countryside, Forge Mill Farm, Sandwell Valley Visitor Centre, RSPB Visitor Centre Adventure Playground, Visitor Attractions, Heritage Sites and Monuments, Mountain Bike Tracks, Outdoor Sports Facilities, and Walking Routes for all ages and lots more. 

      Sandwell Valley is estimated to attract around 1m visitors a year and has an ambitious target to increase visitors to our attractions on site to over 200,000 a year in the next 5 years. Sandwell Valley has recently started a phased approach to improvements, with phase one including enhanced Sandwell Valley Visitor Centre and Forge Mill Farm offerings, new branding and marketing assets, catering improvements, and transition to digital and more efficient operational management. We have also secured investment in 22/23 into a new play barn and caf? facility at Forge Mill Farm, and Victorian Kitchen Garden built facilities improvements at Sandwell Valley Visitor Centre. There is currently a clear business plan in place for the current income sources, to achieve a self-sustained position within the next three financial years. 

      We are also embarking on a master planning exercise that will see consultation on investment plans into the wider Sandwell Valley estate (c700 hectares), increasing our venue hire and education offerings, and securing the long-term sustainability of the estate. This scoping and master plan exercise will address the areas not yet considered, including additional income streams, use of buildings and land not currently utilised fully or at all, transport and traffic management options for visitor ingress and egress, heritage development and management across the Sandwell Valley estate, and potential investment and funding sources.  

      The delivery of this marketing strategy will need to be the following timescales (these are deadlines, and may be brought forward dependent on consultancy availability and officer time): 
      1. Masterplan Research and Pre-Consultation (Nov / Dec 22) 
      2. Draft Masterplan for early review / discussions (Jan 23)
      3. Draft Masterplan consultation (Jan / Feb 23)
      4. Final Masterplan and Implementation Plan for decision (Mar 23) 
      5. Masterplan Cabinet Report (including Cabinet Workshop, involving masterplan consultancy) (Mar / Apr 23)
Industry: Research and development services and related consultancy services - 73000000
Address: Freeth Street, Oldbury, West Midlands, B69 3DE, United Kingdom

Tender Name: The Procurement and In-Service Support for a Man-Portable Digital X-Ray System
Description:
1.	Introduction 

1.1	The DE&S Specialist EODS, [Explosive Ordnance Disposal & Search], Exploitation and Countermeasures (SEEC) team intends to competitively assess, select and award a contract to deliver and support a digital X-Ray capability for use by UK Armed Forces during Improvised Explosive Device Disposal operations. This Contract will deliver an initial order of 22 units with potential to purchase additional units over the Contract duration.

1.2	The CASEMAKER capability shall provide a through-barrier system, specifically X-Ray, consisting of, but not limited to, an X-Ray generator, a detector panel, and a laptop used to display and manipulate the image. 

1.3	The system needs to comply with MOD standards and policies for quality, safety, security and cyber, amongst others. Full details shall be provided at the Invitation to Tender (ITT) stage of the competition.

1.4	The competitive procedure will be managed in accordance with a Restricted procedure under Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations 2011.

1.5	You may express your interest in this requirement by completing the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire (PQQ) found at https://contracts.mod.uk/esop/guest/go/opportunity/detail?opportunityId=54785. The full requirement will be issued in the ITT and suppliers will be given appropriate time to respond with their tenders. The Authority shall take forward a maximum of six suppliers that have provided a compliant response to the PQQ. The six highest scoring compliant suppliers will be invited to tender.

1.6	During the Tender Evaluation Phase, there is a requirement for the Potential Providers to provide one (1) complete system for trials in support of the tender evaluation. The system would need to be available upon request in accordance with the indicative timescales set out in the supplementary information. The supplier shall provide its goods for trial at its own cost.  Complete details on the testing will be released in the ITT.

Tender Name: 23FND002 The People's Projects - Voting Adjudicator
Department: Big Lottery Fund, operating as The National Lottery Community Fund
Description:
The People's Projects: The National Lottery Community Fund has again teamed up with The National Lottery, ITV, UTV, and this year the Sunday Mail in Scotland to give community organisations the chance to apply for up to £70,000 of National Lottery funding. After a high-profile national campaign, the winners will be decided by public vote, giving National Lottery players and the public a say in how National Lottery money is awarded.

In May 2023 five shortlisted projects, per region, in the 16 ITV regions and Scotland regions will be put forward for a public vote (80 ITV projects, 15 Scotland projects, 95 projects in total).

To ensure The People's Projects vote is fair and accessible to all, the Fund requires an independent third party with experience in elections, voting and ballots to:

* Scrutinise, audit, validate and count online votes, and a prepaid postal vote, and provide final overall voting figures.

* Run a free phone (also with a Welsh language option) line with a recorded message giving details on how to vote.

These services are required to ensure The People's Projects and its partners (ITV and others) compliance regulations are met and that the vote is fair and accurate and accessible.

This will be an eight month contract until 01st September 2023. The maximum budget for this procurement is £100,000 including expenses (excluding VAT).

This contract will be subject to the Fund's standard terms and conditions. These can be accessed via the following link: https://www.tnlcommunityfund.org.uk/about/customer-service/supplier-zone/terms-and-conditions (this contract will be subject to our terms and conditions for over £10,000). A submission received as part of this tender process shall constitute acceptance of these terms and conditions, so bidders are advised to review these with their legal team whilst the tender is still live.

This tender will be conducted on BravoSolution, the Fund's chosen e-tendering platform. In order to access the tender, bidders will first need to register themselves on the portal. This can be done via the following link: https://tnlcommunityfund.bravosolution.co.uk/

Tender Name: Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent Challenging Behaviour Security Service
Description:
The Staffordshire and Stoke-on-Trent Integrated Care Board currently commission the Challenging Patient Behaviour Service (CBSS) across the ICB area. The CBSS has been in place for many years having previously been known as the General Practice Security Service.   The service provides security services and personnel to individual GP practices and for the Special Allocations Service (SAS) providers. 

This service allows GPs and their staff to deliver services to patients who the practice determine have been verbally or physically aggressive in the past, to an extent where advice and support is required, to ensure the safety of staff and patients whilst undertaking appointments, clinics and consultations.  The service also provides advice to practices regarding how best to deal with challenging patients.  

The service provides for Challenging Behaviour Security Officer(s) to be made available to Staffordshire and Stoke-on-Trent GP practices as required and also to attend Special Allocations Scheme providers (there are 4 providers across Staffordshire and Stoke-on-Trent). Commissioners have set a fixed tariff for provision of the CBSS and details of this can be found with the ITT documents. 

Further details including how to place a bid, please follow this link:  https://mlcsu.bravosolution.co.uk and search for ITT number 974.

Tender Name: Office for Product Safety and Standards- Testing of Suncreen
Department: Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy
Description:
The Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS); Office for Product Safety and Standards (OPSS) is an appointed market surveillance authority, responsible for (via the Secretary of State) enforcing the General Product Safety Regulations (GPSR) within the UK.

Suppliers are strongly encouraged to read the text at the following link in order to gain a full understanding of the enforcement services role within OPSS:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/national-regulation-enforcement-services 

BEIS will carry out assessments and require testing to determine the current levels of compliance in the cosmetics sector, specifically sunscreen products in the UK in line with the retained Regulation (EC) No 1223/2009 on Cosmetic Products and the Cosmetic Products Enforcement Regulations 2013.

To investigate sunscreen products to verify compliance with applicable standards.
The project aims to verify the product formulation for any unsafe chemicals, to confirm whether manufacturers accurately state the level of the claimed determination of full sunscreen protection/level of protection, and to determine the effectiveness of the products.

The retained Regulation (EC) No 1223/2009 and the Cosmetic Products Enforcement Regulations 2013.          
To perform testing on a selection of about 10 sunscreen products to verify and determine level of compliance with the following above Regulations, and below standards (and any amendments to these).

It is expected the successful bidder will undertake skin testing on volunteers in order to fulfil this requirement.

In order to apply for this tender, please register on the following website https://beisgroup.ukp.app.jaggaer.com/. Please contact the BEIS Jaggaer team at beiscommercialmianddata@beis.gov.uk for any registration queries. Please upload your proposal before the deadline via BEIS Jaggaer Portal.
For questions regarding the procurement process please contact Cara Jenkins (cara.jenkins@beis.gov.uk).

Address: 1 Victoria Street, London, SW1H 0ET, England

Tender Name: Lancaster University - Spine Duct Strategic Improvements project - 3- year Framework
Description:
Description:  Lancaster University is seeking to appoint a Principle Contractor to undertake the Spine Duct Strategic Improvements Project.  It is envisaged that this project will span approximately 3 years and the contract will be awarded as a Framework so the University can Call off packages of work.  The first package of work will commence mid-February 2023 until April 2023 and there will be a second Call Off commencing July 2023, completing before the end of September 2023.  Further phases will then be awarded in Summer 2024 and Summer 2025.

The project will target strategic and technical issues identified within the University Spine Duct, which is address Gas Detection and Heat Detection within the ducts in Phase 1 (February - April 2023). Phase 2 (July 2023-September 2023) will include Ventilation, Fire Stopping, Signage and Electrical Improvement Works to the South Spine Ducts. This includes an element of civils and buildings work at ground level. Phase 3 (July 2024 - September 2024) will include Ventilation, Fire Stopping, Signage and Electrical Improvement Works to the North Spine Ducts. This includes an element of civils and buildings work at ground level. The final phase (Phase 4) (July 2025 - September 2025) will include the installation of new gas pipework, gas isolation valves and bypass, making the existing Energy Centre circa 1965 gas pipework and duct redundant.

The estimated value of the project over the 3 year, 4 phase) Framework is £1.4 million net construction cost.

Intended tender method: Design & Build - Single Stage - fixed lump sum for the first 2 Call Off packages of works on the basis of RIBA Stage 4 design information. Phases 3 and 4 will be lump sum at tender stage, with open book cost uplift for any costs increases, over and above the tender sum cost, negotiated and agreed with Cost Consultant prior to award of each remaining phase.
The tender will be an Open tender. 
The location of the site is North and South Spine  Bailrigg Campus, Lancaster, LA1 4YW.
When the tender is released the University will host an accompanied site visit. The date will be advertised in due course on Contracts Finder and full details provided in the tender documentation.

All procurement documents will be available free of charge via the University's e-tendering portal: In-Tend
https://in-tendhost.co.uk/lancaster/
DOCUMENTS ONCE RELEASED; MUST BE ACCESSED AND SUBMISSIONS MADE VIA THIS PORTAL.  
Interested companies are encouraged to register on the In-Tend system in advance so they are alerted to the release of the documents without delay.

In-Tend Support:
Phone: 0845 557 8079
E-mail: support@in-tend.com
Web : https://in-tendhost.co.uk/lancaster/aspx/Help

The University is not inviting any formal expressions of interest at this stage. Please await the release of the procurement documentation.
Address: University House, LANCASTER, LA14YW, England

Tender Name: Employment Advisors in IAPT for NHS Derby and Derbyshire ICB
Department: NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands Commissioning Support Unit
Description:
NHS Derby and Derbyshire Integrated Care Board (DDICB) is inviting suitably qualified and experienced providers to express interest in delivering an Employment Advisors in IAPT service, by responding to this opportunity as required and described in the published tender documentation. NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands CSU (AGCSU) is acting as an agent for and on behalf of the Commissioner and is supporting the procurement process.

The process is a one stage open process.

Employment Advisors (EA) in IAPT (Improving Access to Psychological Therapies) is a project jointly run by the DWP (Department for Work and Pensions) and DoHSC (Department of Health and Social Care). It has been set up in recognition that there are poorer employment outcomes for people with coexisting mental and physical health problems. It aims to increase the availability of employment support within IAPT services to ensure that there is sufficient employment support capacity to provide a fully integrated therapy and employment support for people who are employed, those off sick from work and those who are unemployed and looking to find work.

Commissioners are currently awaiting confirmation of funding from DWP to support these services beyond March 2025. Due to timescales to undertake a compliant process, Commissioners are proceeding with a formal process and will confirm once funding has been received.

The contract will be for an initial 2 years from 1st April 2023 to 31st March 2025, with the Commissioner having the option to extend the Contract for up to a further 1 year (subject to further confirmation of external funding beyond initial term).

Please note there is a financial threshold associated with this procurement. Any bids exceeding £1,044,000.00 per annum will be excluded from evaluation and disqualified from the process. No bids over £1,044,000.00 will be accepted.

Full details of the service can be found and are included as part of the documentation within the project on EU-Supply. To access the documentation please visit EU-Supply on the link below and access project 58296 - Employment Advisors in IAPT for NHS Derby and Derbyshire ICB: https://uk.eu-supply.com/login.asp?B=UK
Address: Cardinal Square, 10 Nottingham Road, Derby, DE13QT, ENG

Tender Name: Provision of Trauma Informed Practitioners.
Description:
Office of the Police and Crime Commissioner for Hampshire and the Isle of Wight (OPCC) invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the provision of Trauma Informed Practitioners.

      The OPCC is seeking to appoint full time Trauma Informed Practitioners (TIPs) to patrol with police to help police embed Trauma Informed Policing.

      The Contract will commence on 3rd January 2023 and will be for a period of 27 months until 31st March 2025.

      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Wednesday 5th October 2022.  

      How to obtain the Tender Documents
      The Tender documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting 'View Details' on the relevant tender advert and clicking the 'Express Interest' tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs - 'Tender', 'ITT - documents', 'Correspondence', 'Clarifications' and 'History'. Select the 2nd tab (ITT - documents) where you will find useful information under 'Tender Details' continue to scroll down to the heading 'Tender Documents Received' where you will be able to view / download the documents.

      Please download all the documents and read very carefully.

      Opting In and Opting Out
      Please note you are required to 'Opt In' before you can access the 'My tender Return' to start populating your response. 

      PLEASE NOTE you are required to 'Opt In' to view & complete the 2 Questionnaires for this project. 

      The 'Opt Out' functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option of declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision.

      You can choose to 'Opt In' at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to 'Opt Out'.

      Further Guidance
      In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender - download and upload documents / returns and if required, register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-tend site under the 'Help' or 'Information for Suppliers' buttons.

      Receiving Notification Emails
      To ensure you receive email alerts and notifications from our system, please add the email domain `@in-tendorganiser.co.uk`  to your Safe Senders list.

Tender Name: Consultancy Services
Description:
The BBC is launching a new multi-supplier Consultancy Services framework that will commence in April 2023. The framework will provide pan-BBC personnel with access to suppliers that can individually supply a broad range of professional services.

Successful suppliers awarded a place on the framework will have experience and capabilities to meet all the BBC's distinct service requirements across the 3 core disciplines of Strategy, Technology and Finance.

The framework will have a term of 4 years and the estimated spend is £4m per year. The estimated spend for the full 4 year term is a maximum of £16m.

The disciplines and a summary of the sub-criteria for each are:

Strategy - Corporate Strategy, Business Model Transformation, Economic Policy, Organisational Strategy, Mergers & Acquisitions, Digital Strategy, Business Process Management, Outsourcing, Broadcast & Media

Technology - Technology Assessment, Technology Strategy, IT Industry Assessment, User Technology, IT Innovation, IT Transformation Management, IT Cyber Risk

Finance - Corporate Finance, Business Appraisal, Crisis & Recovery, Risk Management, Accounting Advisory, Tax Advisory, Real Estate Advisory, Forensics & Litigation.

The scope of the Framework will also include consultancy services for HR and Programme Management.

Tender Name: CYP-MH Crisis Telephone Lines Training - Health Education England
Description:
NHS Health Education England (HEE - the Commissioner) are commencing a tender for the provision for Children and Young People (CYP) Mental Health Crisis Telephone Lines Training.

Health Education England (HEE) will be looking for a provider to build upon the successful pilot delivered in 2021-2022 to address the needs of NHS Crisis Mental Healthcare staff through CYP crisis telephone training. This training programme will equip the workforce with the skills, knowledge, and confidence to be able to respond effectively to the particular needs of children and young people, and/or their parents and carers, presenting in crisis via the telephone.

The procurement exercise will support in identifying a suitable provider to develop and deliver, building on lessons learnt from the initial pilot, foundation level training to improve staff confidence in handling distressing calls from CYP presenting in mental health crisis, or their parents/carers communicating on their behalf.

This is an exciting opportunity to support Health Education England with this provision.

The maximum financial envelope for this procurement exercise is £300,000 (+Vat) £100,000 per year (+Vat). The contract period will be up until 31st March 2023, with the option to extend by up to a further two (2) years (1+1) subject to annual review and available budget.

The deadline for submission of completed ITT submissions is 3rd October 2022 at 12:00pm (midday).

Late submissions will not be accepted therefore, please submit in good time prior to the deadline date and time. All communications should be made via the messaging function on the e-Tendering portal during the tender exercise.

The Contracting Authority requests that all communications are channelled through the e-portal system and not with the Contracting Authority itself other than as expressly permitted within this ITT.

Tender Name: Refurbishment of Goldsmiths Toilets
Description:
Crowborough Town Council manages and maintains five playground sites across Crowborough. At our Goldsmiths Recreation ground we have two full sized football pitches and a junior football pitch, a running track, outdoor gym, playground, leisure centre, boating lake, petanque and a skatepark. 
The site is well used by residents and the toilets are used daily. The current condition of the toilets has slowly deteriorated, and they are now in need of refurbishment. 
The invitation to tender is for the complete renovation of the male, female and disabled toilets including all fixtures and fittings and décor.  
Crowborough Town Council intends to enter into a contract with a suitably qualified and experienced contractor to undertake this project.

Crowborough Town Council, hereinafter referred to as CTC, invites tenders for the refurbishment of the existing toilets situated at Goldsmiths Recreation Ground.
TENDERS MUST BE SUBMITTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS TENDERS NOT COMPLYING WITH THESE INSTRUCTIONS IN ANY PARTICULAR WAY MAY BE REJECTED BY THE COUNCIL WHOSE DECISION IN THE MATTER SHALL BE FINAL.
